intro: Hypochaeris setigera, commonly known as the common sowthistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of spoon-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa but has been introduced to other regions, including North America. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found along roadsides and in cultivated fields. Hypochaeris setigera is an annual or biennial plant that reproduces through seeds dispersed by wind and animals.
